article: After 21 years of marriage, my wife wanted me to take another woman out to dinner.  This other  woman was my mother, who has been a widow for 19 years, but my work had made  _  impossible to visit her very often. That night I called to  _  her to go out for dinner."What's wrong? Are you  _  ?"she asked. "I thought that it would be  _  to spend some time with you. Just the two of us,"I answered. She thought about it  for a  moment, and agreed. That Friday after work,  _  I drove to pick her up, I was a bit nervous. When I arrived at her house, I  _  that, she, too, seemed to be  _  about our date. She had curled her hair and was wearing the dress that she had worn to  _  her last wedding anniversary. We went to a restaurant that,  _  not elegant, was very nice and cozy. When I read the menu, Mom sat there  _  at me. A nostalgic smile was  _  her lips. During the dinner, we had a(an)  _  conversation--nothing special but catching up on recent events of each other's life. A few days  _  , my mother died of a heart attack. It happened so suddenly that I didn't have a chance to do  _  for her. Sometime later, I received an envelope with a note  _  "You will never know what that night meant to me. I'm looking forward to the  _  dinner. I love you, Son." At that moment, I understood the importance of saying in time"I LOVE YOU". Nothing in life is more important than your  _  . Give them the time they deserve, because these things cannot be  put off  till"some other time".
